oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Serum Fatty Acid and 3-hydroxybutyrate Concentrations Depend on the Sample Time Related to the First Feed Intake in Dairy Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Quiroz-Rocha, G. F.
LeBlanc, S.
Duffield, T.
Wood, R. D.
Leslie, K. E.
Jacobs, R. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy cows
blood testing
fatty acids
BHB
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When sampling cows to monitoring NEB in the peripartum, there is twice the probability of detecting animals with values ~0.4 mmol/L if they are sampled one hour before the first feed offer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2006; 306
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 2006 American Association of Bovine Practitioners
